siteObject.author: Ivan Valchev
siteObject.description: John Newberie mentions the fortress on the Kaliakra cape
siteObject.sourceInformation: Newberie, John. Two voyages of Master John Newberie, One, into the Holy Land, The other to Balsara, Ormus, Persia, and backe thorow Turkie. In: Hakluytus Posthumus or, Purchas His Pilgrimes: Contayning a History of the World in Sea Voyages and Lande Travells by Englishmen and Others. Cambridge Library Collection - Maritime Exploration. Cambridge, 2014, p. 477.
siteObject.annotation: John Newberie traveled by sea from Constantinople to the Danube delta and he passed near the Kaliakra fortress.
siteObject.sourceContent: The fourteenth day in the morning we passed by a Castle called Caliacca, which standeth upon the Cape of a Land, and hath to the Eastward two small Pillars, and neere unto them a great stone much like a man.
